metadata.Title: CVE-2011-3744 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - low.
metadata.Description: HTML Purifier 4.2.0 allows remote attackers to obtain sensitive information via a direct request to a .php file, which reveals the installation path in an error message, as demonstrated by tests/PHPT/Reporter/SimpleTest.php and certain other files.

notes.Note: tyhicks> I don't see anything in the 4.3.0 changelog suggesting that this was fixed. Marking as 'needed' in Oneiric and upstream.

criterions.comment: php-htmlpurifier: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
